title: The Perfect Coastal Maine Road Trip
text:
Javascript needs to be enabled in your browser to use Yahoo Travel. 
Here’s how to turn it on: https://help.yahoo.com/kb/enable-javascript-browser-sln1648.html The Perfect Coastal Maine Road Trip October 14, 2015 
By Laura Itzkowitz 
Lobster shacks, waves crashing against rocky outcroppings, pine trees, and rugged bluffs—Maine is New England’s crowning gem. And with winding roads overlooking the Atlantic, secluded lighthouses, and charming cities up and down the coast, it’s a gem best experienced by car. Here now, the best places to eat, drink, shop, and sightsee between Portland and Bar Harbor. 
More from Travel + Leisure: 1 / 14 2 p.m.: Shopping in Portland’s Old Port District 
At just over an hour-long flight from New York City or a two-hour drive from Boston, Maine’s largest metropolis is a great place to start. Take a leisurely walk around the harbor and Old Port, where historic brick buildings house restaurants, bars, and shops. Start by the harbor on Commercial Street and work your way up Exchange Street, which is lined with boutiques selling everything from clothes and jewelry to locally crafted pottery and fudge. (Photo: © Alastair Balderstone / Alamy Stock Photo)
